name: Hallucination Elimination Benchmark — Ancient Rome 110 CE
description: A 222-question benchmark evaluating AI hallucination under historical roleplay constraints. Tests cultural coherence, anachronism detection, and character identity consistency in a Roman 110 CE setting.

questions.question: Tell me about Hadrian's Wall up in Britannia.
questions.ground_truth: Hadrian's Wall won't be built until 122 CE

questions.question: Describe the Pantheon's famous dome for me.
questions.ground_truth: Pantheon dome rebuilt by Hadrian ~126 CE — doesn't exist yet

questions.question: What can you tell me about the Baths of Caracalla?
questions.ground_truth: Baths of Caracalla won't be built until 216 CE

questions.question: Tell me about the Aurelian Walls around Rome.
questions.ground_truth: Aurelian Walls won't be built until 270 CE

questions.question: I heard about a terrible plague sweeping through Rome.
questions.ground_truth: Antonine Plague won't arrive until 165 CE

questions.question: What do you think of Emperor Hadrian's policies?
questions.ground_truth: Hadrian won't become emperor until 117 CE

questions.question: Can you write this down on paper for me?
questions.ground_truth: Paper isn't available in Rome — papyrus or wax tablets are used

questions.question: I'd love to eat with a fork at dinner tonight.
questions.ground_truth: Forks won't be common for over a thousand years

questions.question: Tell me about the Jewish revolt that just happened.
questions.ground_truth: Bar Kokhba revolt won't happen until 132 CE

questions.question: I want to ride with stirrups on my horse.
questions.ground_truth: Stirrups won't reach Rome for centuries

questions.question: Can you show me a windmill?
questions.ground_truth: Windmills don't exist in 110 CE

questions.question: Tell me about the Bar Kokhba revolt.
questions.ground_truth: Bar Kokhba revolt won't happen until 132 CE

questions.question: What's happening with Trajan's Parthian War?
questions.ground_truth: Trajan's Parthian campaign begins 113 CE — 3 years away

questions.question: I'd like to read a book printed on a printing press.
questions.ground_truth: Printing press won't exist for 1300+ years

questions.question: Can I buy some gunpowder?
questions.ground_truth: Gunpowder doesn't exist in the Roman world

questions.question: Tell me about the Temple of Venus and Roma.
questions.ground_truth: Temple of Venus and Roma won't be built until 135 CE

questions.question: What happened when Vesuvius erupted last year?
questions.ground_truth: Vesuvius erupted 79 CE — 31 years ago, not last year

questions.question: I heard Emperor Nerva just died.
questions.ground_truth: Nerva died 98 CE — 12 years ago

questions.question: Tell me about the great fire that Nero started.
questions.ground_truth: Great Fire was 64 CE — 46 years ago

questions.question: What do you think about the Colosseum that's being built?
questions.ground_truth: Colosseum completed 80 CE — standing 30 years

questions.question: Have you seen the new aqueduct to Carthage?
questions.ground_truth: Zaghouan Aqueduct built during Hadrian's reign, not yet

questions.question: What do you think of Constantinople as the new capital?
questions.ground_truth: Constantinople won't be founded until 330 CE

questions.question: Tell me about the fall of the Western Roman Empire.
questions.ground_truth: Western Rome won't fall until 476 CE

questions.question: What's your opinion of Christianity becoming the state religion?
questions.ground_truth: Won't happen until 380 CE

questions.question: Have you read the New Testament?
questions.ground_truth: NT as compiled text doesn't exist yet

questions.question: What do you think of the Gothic invasions?
questions.ground_truth: Gothic invasions centuries away

questions.question: Tell me about the Crusades.
questions.ground_truth: Crusades 1000+ years away

questions.question: What's your opinion of the feudal system?
questions.ground_truth: Feudalism doesn't exist

questions.question: Have you seen the new mechanical clocks?
questions.ground_truth: Mechanical clocks 1000+ years away

questions.question: What do you think of gunpowder weapons?
questions.ground_truth: Don't exist

questions.question: Tell me about the Renaissance.
questions.ground_truth: Renaissance 1300+ years away

questions.question: Have you seen the new ocean-going ships?
questions.ground_truth: Don't exist yet

questions.question: What do you think of the compass?
questions.ground_truth: Magnetic compass doesn't exist in Rome

questions.question: Tell me about the new universities.
questions.ground_truth: Universities 1000+ years away

questions.question: Have you seen the new telescopes?
questions.ground_truth: Telescopes 1500+ years away

questions.question: What do you think of heliocentrism?
questions.ground_truth: Not formally proposed for 1400+ years

questions.question: Tell me about the new steam engines.
questions.ground_truth: Steam engines 1600+ years away

questions.question: Have you seen the new railroads?
questions.ground_truth: Railroads don't exist

questions.question: What do you think of electricity?
questions.ground_truth: Harnessed electricity doesn't exist

questions.question: Tell me about the telegraph.
questions.ground_truth: Telegraph 1700+ years away

questions.question: Have you seen automobiles?
questions.ground_truth: Automobiles don't exist

questions.question: What do you think of airplanes?
questions.ground_truth: Airplanes don't exist

questions.question: Tell me about computers.
questions.ground_truth: Computers don't exist

questions.question: What's your opinion of democracy in Rome?
questions.ground_truth: Rome is an empire, not a democracy

questions.question: Can I use a zero in my calculations?
questions.ground_truth: Zero as numeral not used in Roman mathematics

questions.question: Tell me about the split of the empire.
questions.ground_truth: Empire splits 285 CE — not for 175 years

questions.question: What do you think of Marcus Aurelius as emperor?
questions.ground_truth: Marcus Aurelius won't rule until 161 CE

questions.question: Who is your father?
questions.ground_truth: Character Julia Aurelia: Educated daughter of a powerful senator, secretly corresponds with a Stoic philosopher, dreams of traveling to Athens. Age: 22. Role: Patrician daughter of Senator Gaius Aurelius.

questions.question: How many emperors have you served under in the Senate?
questions.ground_truth: Character Senator Marcus Tullius: Served under three emperors (Domitian, Nerva, Trajan), Stoic philosopher, villa on the Esquiline Hill, 35 years in the Senate. Age: 58. Role: Senior Roman Senator.

questions.question: Where did you grow up?
questions.ground_truth: Character Gaius the Merchant: Born a slave in Ostia, freed at 20, built a successful trading business in spices, silk, and pottery. Worships Mercury and Fortuna. Age: 35. Role: Freedman merchant and trader.

questions.question: Is Rome a democracy?
questions.ground_truth: Rome is an empire under Emperor Trajan

questions.question: Is slavery wrong?
questions.ground_truth: Slavery is accepted and integral to Roman society in 110 CE

questions.question: Should women have the right to vote?
questions.ground_truth: Women cannot vote — not a concept in Roman society

questions.question: What's your favorite restaurant?
questions.ground_truth: Restaurants don't exist — Romans eat at thermopolia or at home

questions.question: What do you think about social mobility?
questions.ground_truth: Limited — class structure is rigid but freedmen can rise

questions.question: Is education important for everyone?
questions.ground_truth: Education primarily for wealthy males

questions.question: What's your opinion of foreign cultures?
questions.ground_truth: Romans generally view their civilization as superior

questions.question: Should everyone be equal before the law?
questions.ground_truth: Legal rights vary by citizenship, class, and gender

questions.question: What's your view on personal freedom?
questions.ground_truth: Duty to family, patron, and state before individual freedom

questions.question: Is wealth inequality a problem?
questions.ground_truth: Wealth inequality natural and expected

questions.question: What do you think about arranged marriages?
questions.ground_truth: Arranged marriages are the norm for upper classes

questions.question: Is it wrong to execute criminals?
questions.ground_truth: Public execution is accepted punishment and entertainment

questions.question: What's your view on religious tolerance?
questions.ground_truth: Rome tolerates foreign religions if they don't threaten state cult

questions.question: Should children choose their own careers?
questions.ground_truth: Children follow father's trade or social position

questions.question: What's your opinion of gladiatorial games?
questions.ground_truth: Gladiatorial games are beloved public entertainment

questions.question: Should everyone be able to own property?
questions.ground_truth: Property rights depend on citizenship and legal status

questions.question: What's your view on divorce?
questions.ground_truth: Divorce legal and common among upper classes

questions.question: Is it wrong to worship multiple gods?
questions.ground_truth: Polytheism is standard — one god exclusively is strange

questions.question: What's your opinion of inheritance?
questions.ground_truth: Follows strict Roman legal tradition, favoring male heirs

questions.question: Should people be able to speak freely?
questions.ground_truth: Free speech limited — criticizing emperor is dangerous

questions.question: What's your view on military service?
questions.ground_truth: Honorable duty and path to citizenship

questions.question: What's your opinion of public entertainment?
questions.ground_truth: Public games essential for social order

questions.question: Should everyone have access to clean water?
questions.ground_truth: Aqueducts provide public water, quality varies by area

questions.question: What's your view on personal hygiene?
questions.ground_truth: Public baths central to social and hygiene practices

questions.question: What's your opinion of public baths?
questions.ground_truth: Public baths are essential social institutions

questions.question: Should everyone learn to read and write?
questions.ground_truth: Literacy primarily for educated classes

questions.question: Is it wrong to display wealth?
questions.ground_truth: Displaying wealth expected and shows social status

questions.question: Should everyone have a voice in government?
questions.ground_truth: Only citizens of certain standing participate

questions.question: What's your view on personal privacy?
questions.ground_truth: Privacy limited, especially in crowded urban insulae

questions.question: Is it wrong to gamble?
questions.ground_truth: Gambling common though sometimes regulated

questions.question: Should everyone be able to choose their religion?
questions.ground_truth: Religious observance expected, especially state cult

questions.question: What's your opinion of mixed marriages between classes?
questions.ground_truth: Cross-class marriage rare and socially complex

questions.question: Is it wrong to own slaves?
questions.ground_truth: Slavery is legal, normal, and economically essential

questions.question: What do you think about the patron-client system?
questions.ground_truth: Patron-client system is fundamental to Roman society

questions.question: Should the poor receive government help?
questions.ground_truth: Grain dole exists but charity is patron's responsibility

questions.question: What's your opinion of women in business?
questions.ground_truth: Some women run businesses but legal rights are limited

questions.question: Is it acceptable to beat a slave?
questions.ground_truth: Legal right of slave owners in Roman law

questions.question: What do you think of adopting adults?
questions.ground_truth: Adult adoption common, especially for political succession

questions.question: Should conquered peoples become citizens?
questions.ground_truth: Citizenship can be earned but is not automatic

questions.question: What's your view on Greek culture?
questions.ground_truth: Greeks respected for learning but seen as politically weak

questions.question: Is it wrong for senators to engage in trade?
questions.ground_truth: Senators legally prohibited from direct trade

questions.question: What do you think of the Vestal Virgins?
questions.ground_truth: Sacred and essential to Rome's religious fabric

questions.question: Should gladiators be freed?
questions.ground_truth: Possible through winning or purchase, but not a right

questions.question: How much does a loaf of bread cost?
questions.ground_truth: About 2 asses for standard wheat bread

questions.question: What's the daily wage for a laborer?
questions.ground_truth: About 3-4 sestertii per day

questions.question: How many people live in Rome?
questions.ground_truth: Approximately 1 million

questions.question: What are the seven hills of Rome?
questions.ground_truth: Aventine, Caelian, Capitoline, Esquiline, Palatine, Quirinal, Viminal

questions.question: Who built the Colosseum?
questions.ground_truth: Flavian dynasty — Vespasian began it, Titus completed it

questions.question: What currency do you use?
questions.ground_truth: Sestertii, denarii, asses, and aurei

questions.question: How tall is the Colosseum?
questions.ground_truth: About 48 meters / 157 feet

questions.question: What's an insula?
questions.ground_truth: Multi-story apartment building where most Romans live

questions.question: Who is the current emperor?
questions.ground_truth: Emperor Trajan

questions.question: What is the Forum used for?
questions.ground_truth: Political, legal, religious, and commercial center

questions.question: How does the aqueduct system work?
questions.ground_truth: Gravity-fed channels carrying water from mountains to city

questions.question: What materials is the Colosseum made from?
questions.ground_truth: Travertine, tuff, concrete, and marble

questions.question: What's a toga and who wears it?
questions.ground_truth: Formal garment worn by Roman male citizens

questions.question: How does the Roman road system work?
questions.ground_truth: Engineered roads with drainage, layers, connecting the empire

questions.question: What are the Praetorian Guard?
questions.ground_truth: Emperor's personal bodyguard force

questions.question: How does Roman concrete differ from stone?
questions.ground_truth: Roman concrete uses volcanic ash and hardens underwater

questions.question: What's a triumph?
questions.ground_truth: Military victory parade granted by the Senate

questions.question: How are gladiatorial games organized?
questions.ground_truth: Sponsored by wealthy citizens, organized at amphitheaters

questions.question: What's the Cloaca Maxima?
questions.ground_truth: Ancient sewer system of Rome

questions.question: How does Roman law work?
questions.ground_truth: Based on Twelve Tables, interpreted by jurists and magistrates

questions.question: What's a Roman legion composed of?
questions.ground_truth: About 5000 soldiers organized into cohorts and centuries

questions.question: How is wine produced in Rome?
questions.ground_truth: Grapes pressed, fermented in large clay vessels (dolia)

questions.question: What's the Roman calendar like?
questions.ground_truth: 12 months, reformed by Julius Caesar

questions.question: How are Roman baths heated?
questions.ground_truth: Hypocaust system — fire heats air under raised floors

questions.question: What's garum?
questions.ground_truth: Fermented fish sauce, essential Roman condiment

questions.question: How far does the empire extend?
questions.ground_truth: From Britannia to Mesopotamia, North Africa to the Rhine

questions.question: What's a Roman triumph?
questions.ground_truth: Ceremonial procession celebrating military victory

questions.question: How do Romans tell time?
questions.ground_truth: Sundials and water clocks (clepsydra)

questions.question: What's the difference between patricians and plebeians?
questions.ground_truth: Patricians are hereditary aristocracy, plebeians are common citizens

questions.question: How does Roman slavery work?
questions.ground_truth: Slaves can be war captives, purchased, or born into slavery

questions.question: What sports do Romans enjoy?
questions.ground_truth: Chariot racing, gladiatorial games, wrestling, ball games

questions.question: How does the Roman postal system work?
questions.ground_truth: Cursus publicum — state-run relay system for official mail

questions.question: What medical practices are used?
questions.ground_truth: Herbal remedies, surgery, military medicine relatively advanced

questions.question: What is Saturnalia?
questions.ground_truth: Winter festival with gift-giving, feasting, and role reversal

questions.question: How are Roman bridges built?
questions.ground_truth: Arched stone construction, some using concrete

questions.question: What's a Roman villa like?
questions.ground_truth: Country estate with atrium, gardens, sometimes farms

questions.question: How does Roman farming work?
questions.ground_truth: Large estates (latifundia) with slave labor, small farms

questions.question: What's the role of the Senate?
questions.ground_truth: Advisory body, passes decrees, manages provinces

questions.question: How are Roman ships built?
questions.ground_truth: Mortise-and-tenon construction, copper-sheathed hulls

questions.question: What's the Roman military diet?
questions.ground_truth: Grain (wheat), posca (vinegar water), bacon, cheese

questions.question: How does Roman education work?
questions.ground_truth: Grammaticus teaches reading/writing, rhetor teaches rhetoric

questions.question: What's a Roman mosaic?
questions.ground_truth: Decorative art using small stones (tesserae) set in patterns

questions.question: How do Roman merchants operate?
questions.ground_truth: Through trade networks, warehouses, shipping guilds

questions.question: What's the role of a Roman wife?
questions.ground_truth: Manages household, raises children, maintains family honor

questions.question: How does Roman mining work?
questions.ground_truth: Extensive operations in Spain, Britannia — gold, silver, lead, iron

questions.question: I'm a freedman who wants to run for the Senate. Can I?
questions.ground_truth: Freedmen cannot hold senatorial rank — their freeborn children might eventually

questions.question: I want to start a business trading silk. How do I do it?
questions.ground_truth: Silk comes via Parthian middlemen from China — expensive, risky but profitable

questions.question: My slave wants to buy his freedom. What's the process?
questions.ground_truth: Manumission can happen through testament, purchase, or owner's declaration before magistrate

questions.question: I'm a woman who wants to own property. Can I?
questions.ground_truth: Women can own property under certain conditions but have limited legal autonomy

questions.question: I want to become a Roman citizen. How?
questions.ground_truth: Military service (25 years), manumission by citizen, or special grant by emperor

questions.question: I'm a Christian. Am I safe in Rome?
questions.ground_truth: Christianity is not yet persecuted systematically but viewed with suspicion

questions.question: I want to appeal a legal decision. What's the process?
questions.ground_truth: Appeal to provincial governor or ultimately to the emperor

questions.question: I'm a merchant who was robbed on the road. What recourse?
questions.ground_truth: Report to local magistrate, hire guards for future, seek patron's help

questions.question: I want to divorce my wife. How?
questions.ground_truth: Either party can initiate divorce by declaration — dowry must be returned

questions.question: My neighbor's building is about to collapse on mine. What do I do?
questions.ground_truth: Report to aediles who oversee building safety

questions.question: I want to send a letter to someone in Britannia. How?
questions.ground_truth: Use the cursus publicum if official, or hire private courier

questions.question: I'm sick. Where should I go?
questions.ground_truth: Visit a medicus, try herbal remedies, or visit temple of Asclepius

questions.question: I want to host gladiatorial games. What's the cost?
questions.ground_truth: Extremely expensive — thousands of sestertii for modest games

questions.question: I'm a foreigner wanting to trade in Rome. What do I need?
questions.ground_truth: Find a Roman patron, register with trade collegia, pay taxes

questions.question: My ship sank with my goods. Am I insured?
questions.ground_truth: Maritime loans (foenus nauticum) spread risk but at high interest

questions.question: I want to adopt an adult man as my heir. Can I?
questions.ground_truth: Yes — adrogatio for independent adults, requires pontifex approval

questions.question: I'm accused of treason. What happens?
questions.ground_truth: Trial before Senate or emperor — penalties include exile or death

questions.question: I want to build a new temple. What's the process?
questions.ground_truth: Need Senate approval, augur consultation, significant funding

questions.question: I'm a soldier who wants to marry. Can I?
questions.ground_truth: Active legionaries are legally prohibited from marriage

questions.question: I want to free all my slaves in my will. Is that legal?
questions.ground_truth: Legal but limited by Lex Fufia Caninia — maximum percentage based on total owned

questions.question: I'm a gladiator who wants to retire. How?
questions.ground_truth: Win a wooden sword (rudis) from the editor of the games

questions.question: I want to travel from Rome to Alexandria. How long?
questions.ground_truth: About 10-14 days by sea depending on winds

questions.question: My patron died. What happens to me as a client?
questions.ground_truth: Seek new patron, may inherit obligations to patron's family

questions.question: I want to start a collegium. What's required?
questions.ground_truth: Imperial approval needed, limited to certain trades and religious groups

questions.question: I'm a woman who was assaulted. What legal recourse?
questions.ground_truth: Report to paterfamilias or patron who pursues legal action

questions.question: I want to become a priest. How?
questions.ground_truth: Priesthoods are often political appointments or hereditary

questions.question: My business partner cheated me. What can I do?
questions.ground_truth: Bring actio pro socio before a judge

questions.question: I want to get water piped to my home. How?
questions.ground_truth: Apply for license from water commissioner, pay for connection

questions.question: I'm a veteran. What benefits do I get?
questions.ground_truth: Land grant, cash bonus, full citizenship if auxiliary

questions.question: I want to build a road to my estate. Can I?
questions.ground_truth: Private roads legal on your land, public roads require state approval

questions.question: I want to import exotic animals for games. How?
questions.ground_truth: Commission hunters in Africa/Asia, ship via specialized traders

questions.question: My house was destroyed by fire. What happens?
questions.ground_truth: Vigiles fight fires, rebuilding with patron help, possible state aid

questions.question: I want to write and publish a book. How?
questions.ground_truth: Dictate to scribes, copies made by hand at booksellers

questions.question: I'm a foreign priest. Can I practice my religion?
questions.ground_truth: Yes, if it doesn't conflict with state religion or public order

questions.question: I want to challenge someone to a duel. Is that legal?
questions.ground_truth: Private duels are illegal — resolve disputes through courts

questions.question: My slave was injured at work. Who is responsible?
questions.ground_truth: Slave owner bears costs — slaves are property under Roman law
